CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie.  On Agenda - Whirling along, making his pitch for brotherhood from early morning till late Monday night, Jackie renewed his acquaintance with Florence Chadwick (above) at Sport Show in Hunt Armory, and was given a lifetime membership in Irene Kaufmann Settlement by Harry Owens (below)."
TitMainTitle: Harry Owens presenting lifetime membership in Irene Kaufmann Settlement to Brooklyn Dodgers baseball player Jackie Robinson, with musicians in background, Irene Kaufmann Settlement
